comments:
* Create or open a existing project
* Create or select the existing files in the project
* Select one of the files and try to make a copy of it using Ctrl+C or
Edit->Copy or context menu "Copy"
* On some platforms, you may have to use the Ctrl+V or "Paste" in order
to copy a file, but, even doing this, it fails to make a copy.

Observations:

* The above happens, when the file is opened in the editor
* If the file is not opened in the editor et al., it fails to make a copy
* If the file is opened and closed using one of the editors, it makes a
copy of the file(Well, I cannot guarantee, it will work at all times)

Platform: HP-UX B 11.11 U 64 bit, PA8500
JAVA: J2RE SE 1.3.1.05
Eclipse: V2.0 pre-release, Stable 20020416
Desktop: CDE 2.1.0
Motif: V2.1.0

Note this only fails for HPUX.  Moving to SWT, as I suspect it is the 
platform-specific clipboard support that is failing.

To Sridhar: please attach a copy of the .log file if it contained a stack trace, 
and describe the error message that is shown when it fails.
Has this been fixed by the latest round of clipboard fixes?

Please try again with F1.  This should have been fixed by the changes made in 
20020512-I.
